text: Bai Chongxi (18 March 1893 â€“ 1 December 1966), also spelled Pai Chung-hsi, was a Chinese Muslim general in the National Revolutionary Army of the Republic of China.Listed General, City of Sydney Library, accessed July 2009 He was a warlord in the Guangxi Province, commanding his own troops and governing Guangxi (though part of the Republic of China). He was often an ally of Chiang Kai-Shek in the politics of the Republic of China. ==Warlord era== Bai Chongxi Born Omar Chongxi Bai was born in Guilin, Guangxi Province. ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1966 deaths Category:People from Guangxi Category:20th-century Chinese military people
title: Bai Chongxi
